mild.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: We had an exceptionally mild winter last year.
mild.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a mild illness or health problem is not serious
mild.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: He suffered a mild heart attack.
Sometimes the symptoms can be quite mild.
a mild case of food poisoning
mild.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a mild feeling is not very strong
mild.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Both men looked at her in mild surprise.
mild.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: a cheese with a pleasant mild flavour
mild.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a mild criticism does not criticize strongly
mild.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: not serious enough to cause much suffering
mild.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: The recession in Germany has been comparatively mild.
mild.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a mild person has a gentle character and does not easily get angry
mild.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: His voice was soft and mild.
mild.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: a mild drug or chemical does not have a very strong effect
mild.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: soft and gentle to your skin
mild.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: mild words or language are not very rude or offensive
mild.translation[0].definitions[9].examp: I heard him mutter a mild swear word.
mild.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: dark beer with a slightly sweet taste
